item.description:
Happy New Year, everyone!

We took a small hiatus over the holidays, but let's dive back into our White Tour de France with a stop in the Rhone valley. A region whose smaller appellation white wines are not easy to find in the US, it's a turn into warmer climate varietals like viognier, roussanne, & marsanne.

I've been able to find a Chateauneuf-de-pape and several Rhone regionals, but if anyone has a lead on wines from the other sub-appellations, give me a shout!

group.name: The MetroWest White Wine Meetup Group

item.name: January Meeting--White Wines of Rhone
